pros: Good benefits in relation to personal health activities
cons: Regular turnover of staff can leave you short sometimes

pros: Lovely genuine people in the centre to work with
cons:
Minimum wage is bad due to the amount of work they expect from you.

Long unsociable hours including starting as early as 5:45am and late shifts ending as late as 10:30pm, 12 hour shifts on the weekends with an unpaid 30 min break.

Poor communication from upper management, also upper management clearly don’t care about lower staff

Casual staff choose what hours suits them and get paid more so there’s little incentive to become fulltime meaning you are constantly short staffed.

pros: Lots of fun people to work with
cons: Some jobs are casual, zero hour jobs.

pros: Very flexible and good pay for the work.
cons: Sometimes can get busy and organisation suffers.

pros: Valued as a member of the company
cons: Not enough hours in small facility

review_title: One of the better places to be a lifeguard
pros:
Lovely shiny new building to work in
Fair pay for the work you do as a lifeguard
Relaxed atmosphere - do your work, and you'll be fine
Very flexible work patterns for casual members of staff and lots of freedom to do shifts that work around you.
cons:
Lifeguarding is a tedious and monotonous job
Some customers can be quite rude and selfish at times
Some people who work there are really, really lazy and will do anything/ hide anywhere just to get out of poolside or cleaning duties for hours on end
While it may be flexible work for casual members of staff, those who have contracts will have work covering late shifts (till 11 pm), weekends (1 in 3) and early starts (0530am) - you can negotiate these though

review_title: Friendly, lively and forward looking place to work
pros: It's an energetic work environment and an ambitious company to work for. People are friendly and always willing to help. No two days are the same and there's always a new challenge around the corner.
cons: People are very busy and trying to get many new things off the ground. Sometimes it feels like we are running to keep up - but it's never dull...

pros:
Always upskilling staff. 
Training courses within the Acadamy but also funding for external courses.
Genuinly keeping to all the organisations values.
cons: Parking fines! Not ideal that we are brutally dealt with by the council and it's very sad that we are not able to successfully communicate over this.

pros: Flexible hours for part time staff, and relatively good salary. Good team spirit.
cons: Building very old and impossible to deliver high levels of customer satisfaction - 'polishing a turd'.

pros: Brilliant help and flexibility for whilst you do part time work at university
cons: Poor organisation and at times can see there being little progression
